entry.tran: 里程碑;重大事件;重要阶段
entry.def: A milestone is an important event in the history or development of something or someone.

example.ex: He said the launch of the party represented a milestone in Zambian history...
example.tran: 他说该党的创立是赞比亚历史上的一个里程碑。

example.ex: Starting school is a milestone for both children and parents.
example.tran: 对于孩子和家长而言，开始上学是一件大事。

entry.tran: （路边显示到某地距离的）里程碑，里程标志
entry.def: A milestone is a stone by the side of a road showing the distances to particular places.

means.word_mean: 1. stone post at side of a road to show distances
2. a significant event in your life (or in a project)

auth_sentence.content: Scottish Natural Heritage called the report an important milestone.

means.word_mean: 重要事件;重要阶段;转折点;里程碑

sentences.en: Several important milestones in foreign policy have been passed by this Congress and they can be chalked up as major accomplishments.
sentences.cn: 这次代表大会通过了对外政策中几起划时代的事件,并且它们可作为主要成就记录下来。

sentences.en: The company passed the ￡6 million milestone this year.

sentences.en: The film proved to be a milestone in the history of cinema.
sentences.cn: 事实证明这部影片是电影史上的一个里程碑。

sentences.en: “Our work”, he continued, warming to his theme, “will be a milestone in scientific history.
sentences.cn: ”“我们的工作， ”他说到这一话题来了劲，“将会是科学史上的里程碑。 ”
